alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Rutherford; Williamson; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 12 at 7:16AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Davidson, northern Rutherford, northeastern Williamson and southwestern Wilson Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 716 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Nolensville, or 8 miles east of Franklin, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Franklin, Smyrna, Brentwood, La Vergne, Nolensville, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Walterhill, Antioch, Lascassas, Triune and Cedars Of Lebanon State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 63 and 75. Interstate 24 between mile markers 58 and 78. Interstate 840 between mile markers 45 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
